page.title: List of people who were beheaded

revisions.rev:
{{Refimprove|list|date=January 2009}} The following is a list of notable '''people who were [[Decapitation|beheaded]]''', arranged alphabetically by country or region and with date of decapitation. Special sections on "Religious figures" and "Fictional characters" are also appended.
These individuals may have lost their heads either accidentally or intentionally (as a form of execution or posthumously).
[[Image:Titian-salome.jpg|thumb|300px|[[Salome]] and the Beheading of [[John the Baptist|St. John the Baptist]], by [[Titian]]]]
[[Image:DecapitaciÃ³n de San Pablo.jpg|right|thumb|300px|''[[Saint Paul]]'s Beheading'' (1887) by [[Enrique Simonet]]]]
==Austria== *[[Joseph Haydn]] (1809) â Celebrated composer posthumously beheaded; see [[Haydn's head]]
==Byzantine Empire== *[[Constantine XI Palaiologos]] (1453), last of the reigning [[Byzantine Emperor]]s (although other sources mention that he disappeared in the last charge and his body was never identified; see article).
==Canada== *[[Murder of Tim McLean|Tim McLean]] (2008) - murdered and decapitated on Greyhound bus.
==China== *[[Guan Yu]] (219) â Executed during civil war by [[Sun Quan]] *[[Guan Ping]] (219) â son of above. Executed during civil war by [[Sun Quan]] *[[Wen Tianxiang]] (1283) - scholar and general *[[Tan Sitong]] (1898) â Executed with 5 others by [[Empress Dowager Cixi]]
==Denmark== *[[Johann Friedrich Struensee]] (1772) â Executed in Copenhagen for [[lÃ¨se-majestÃ©]]. *[[Enevold Brandt]] (1772) â Executed in Copenhagen for [[lÃ¨se-majestÃ©]].
==England== :''For English beheadings after 1707, see the [[List of people who were beheaded#Great Britain|Great Britain section below]]'' [[Image:Heads on spikes.png|right|thumb|The heads of famous English traitors were customarily spiked on [[London Bridge]]]] [[File:Guy de Beauchamp.jpg|right |thumb| Piers Gaveston at the feet of the Earl of Warwick]] *[[Waltheof, Earl of Northumbria]] (1076) â Executed at Winchester by order of [[William I of England|William I]] for taking part in the [[Revolt of the Earls]] *[[William Wallace|Sir William Wallace]] (1305) â famous Scottish resistance fighter, hanged, drawn and quartered by order of [[Edward I]] *[[Piers Gaveston]] (1312) â Executed near Warwick by [[Thomas, 2nd Earl of Lancaster]] in the Baron's Revolt *[[Thomas, 2nd Earl of Lancaster]] â [[Lord High Steward]] â (1322) â Executed at Pontefract by [[Edward II of England]] *[[Edmund FitzAlan, 9th Earl of Arundel]] (1326) â Executed at Hereford by [[Isabella of France|Queen Isabella]], Regent for [[Edward III]] *[[Edmund of Woodstock, 1st Earl of Kent]] â [[Lord Wardens of the Cinque Ports]] â (1330) â Executed at Winchester by [[Isabella of France|Queen Isabella]], Regent for [[Edward III]] *[[Robert Hales|Sir Robert Hales]] â [[Lord High Treasurer]] â (1381) â Executed at [[Tower Hill]] by rebels during the [[Peasants' Revolt]] *[[Simon Sudbury|Simon of Sudbury]] â [[Lord Chancellor]], [[Archbishop of Canterbury]] and [[Bishop of London]] â (1381) â Executed at [[Tower Hill]] by rebels during the [[Peasants' Revolt]] *[[John Cavendish|Sir John Cavendish]] â [[Lord Chief Justice of England and Wales|Chief Justice of the King's Bench]], [[Chancellor (education)|Chancellor]] of the [[University of Cambridge]] â (1381) â Executed in Bury St Edmunds by rebels during the [[Peasants' Revolt]] *[[Simon de Burley|Sir Simon de Burley]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] (1388)- Executed on Tower Hill by the Merciless Parliament for supporting [[Richard II of England]]<ref name= CP> {{cite web |url= http://www.capitalpunishmentuk.org/tower.html|title = Confirmed executions at Tower Hill|accessdate= 2011-03-29}} </ref> *[[John de Beauchamp, 1st Baron Beauchamp (fourth creation)|John de Beauchamp]] (1388) - Executed on Tower Hill by the Merciless Parliament for supporting [[Richard II of England]]<ref name= CP/> * Sir John Berners (1388) - Executed on Tower Hill by the Merciless Parliament for supporting [[Richard II of England]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Richard FitzAlan, 11th Earl of Arundel]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] (1397) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Richard II of England]]<ref name= CP/> *[[William le Scrope| William le Scrope, 1st Earl of Wiltshire]], [[John Bussy|Sir John Bussy]] and [[Henry Green (politician)|Sir Henry Green]] â (1399) Executed in Bristol castle by the Duke of Hereford (soon to be [[Henry IV of England]]) *[[Ralph de Lumley, 1st Baron Lumley]] (1400) â Executed at Cirencester during reign of [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for the [[Epiphany Rising]] *[[Thomas le Despenser, 1st Earl of Gloucester|Thomas le Despenser, 4th Baron le Despencer]] (1400) â Executed at Bristol by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for the [[Epiphany Rising]] *[[John Holland, 1st Duke of Exeter]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Lord Great Chamberlain]] and [[Justice of Chester]] (1400) â Executed at Pleshey Castle, Essex by [[Joan Fitzalan, Countess of Hereford]], with the approval of her son-in-law [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]], for the [[Epiphany Rising]] *[[John Montacute, 3rd Earl of Salisbury]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] (1400) â Executed at Cirencester during reign of [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for the [[Epiphany Rising]] *[[Thomas Holland, 1st Duke of Surrey]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Earl Marshal]] (1400) â Executed at Cirencester during reign of [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for the [[Epiphany Rising]] *[[Bernard Brocas (rebel)|Sir Benard Brocas]] (1400) - Beheaded at Tyburn during reign of [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for the [[Epiphany Rising]]. *[[Thomas Percy, 1st Earl of Worcester]] (1403) â Executed by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] (Hung, drawn and quartered) *Sir Richard Vernon (1403) â Executed by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] (Hung, drawn and quartered) *Sir Richard Venables (1403) â Executed by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] (Hung, drawn and quartered)
*[[Thomas de Mowbray, 4th Earl of Norfolk]] â [[Earl Marshal]] â (1405) â Executed at York by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for treason <ref> {{cite web | url= http://www.mowbray.ddl-web-hosting.com/page36.htm | title = Thomas Mowbray |accessdate= 2011-03-30}}</ref> *[[Richard le Scrope]] Archbishop of York - (1405) - Executed at York by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for treason <ref> {{cite web| url= http://english.cua.edu/faculty/wright/maidston.cfm| title=The Martyrdom of Archbishop Richard Scrope| publisher= The Catholic University of America|accessdate= 2011-03-29}}</ref> *Sir William de Plumpton - (1405) - Executed by [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]] for treason. *[[Richard of Conisburgh, 3rd Earl of Cambridge]] (1415) â Executed at Southhampton by [[Henry V of England]] for his involvement in the [[Southampton Plot]] *[[Henry Scrope, 3rd Baron Scrope of Masham]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] (1415) â Executed at Soutampton by [[Henry V of England]] for his involvement in the [[Southampton Plot]] *[[William de la Pole, 1st Duke of Suffolk|William de la Pole]] (1450) â Beheaded at sea, possibly by order of [[Richard Plantagenet, 3rd Duke of York]] *[[James Fiennes, 1st Baron Saye and Sele]] (1450) - Beheaded in London by rebels led by [[Jack Cade]]. *[[James Touchet, 5th Baron Audley]] (1459) â Executed after [[Battle of Blore Heath]] for being a Lancastrian. *[[Richard Neville, 5th Earl of Salisbury]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]], [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|PC]] â [[Lord Chancellor]] â (1460) â Executed after the [[Battle of Wakefield]] for being a Yorkist *[[Edmund, Earl of Rutland]] (1460) â Executed by [[John Clifford, 9th Baron de Clifford|Lord Clifford]] for being a Yorkist (stabbed to death during the Battle of Wakefield and later decapitated) *[[Thomas Thorpe (Speaker of the House of Commons)|Thomas Thorpe]], speaker (1461) - Beheaded by a London mob. *[[Thomas Courtenay, 14th Earl of Devon]] (1461) â Executed after the [[Battle of Towton]] for being a Lancastrian. *[[Owen Tudor|Sir Owen Tudor]] (1461) â Executed after the [[Battle of Towton]] for being a Lancastrian. *[[James Butler, 5th Earl of Ormond]] â 1st Earl of Wiltshire (1461) â Executed after the [[Battle of Towton]] for being a Lancastrian. *[[Thomas Kyriell|Sir Thomas Kyriell]] (1461) â Executed by [[Margaret of Anjou]] after the [[Second Battle of St Albans]] for being a Yorkist. *[[William Bonville, 1st Baron Bonville]] (1461) â Executed by [[Margaret of Anjou]] after the [[Second Battle of St Albans]] for being a Yorkist. *[[John de Vere, 12th Earl of Oxford]] (1462) â Executed by [[John Tiptoft, 1st Earl of Worcester]] *Lord Aubrey de Vere (1462) â Son of [[John de Vere, 12th Earl of Oxford]] (1462)- Executed at Tower Hill by [[John Tiptoft, 1st Earl of Worcester]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Henry Beaufort, 3rd Duke of Somerset]] (1464) â Beheaded after the [[Battle of Hexham]] for being a Lancastrian *[[Robert Hungerford, 3rd Baron Hungerford]] (1464) - Beheaded at Newcastle after the [[Battle of Hexham]] for being a Lancastrian *[[Thomas de Ros, 10th Baron de Ros]] (1464) â Beheaded at Newcastle after the [[Battle of Hexham]] for being a Lancastrian *[[Philip Wentworth|Sir Philip Wentworth]] (1464) â Beheaded at Middleham after the [[Battle of Hexham]] for being a Lancastrian *Sir [[William Tailboys]] (1464) â Executed after [[Battle of Hexham]] for being a Lancastrian.
*Sir Humphrey Neville (1469) â Executed at York by [[Edward IV]] for being a Lancastrian. *Sir Charles Neville (1469) â Brother of above â Executed at York by [[Edward IV]] for being a Lancastrian *[[Richard Woodville, 1st Earl Rivers]] â [[Lord High Treasurer]] and [[Lord Warden of the Cinque Ports]] â (1469) â Executed by the [[Richard Neville, 16th Earl of Warwick]] for being a Yorkist. *[[John Woodville|Sir John Woodville]] (1469) â Son of above â Executed by the [[Richard Neville, 16th Earl of Warwick]] for being a Yorkist. *Sir Henry Courtenay (1469) â Executed for treason at Salisbury for being a Lancastrian, Brother of Sir Hugh Courtenay and the 14th and 15th Earls of Devon who were all executed for being Lancastrians. *[[William Herbert, 1st Earl of Pembroke (1468 creation)]] (1469) â Executed after [[Battle of Edgecote Moor]] for being a Yorkist. *[[Sir Richard Herbert]] (1469) â Executed after [[Battle of Edgecote Moor]] for being a Yorkist, also illegitimate son of the above. *[[Humphrey Stafford, 1st Earl of Devon]] (1469) â Captured and executed in Bridgewater for being a Yorkist. *[[Richard Welles, 7th Baron Welles]] (1470) â Executed on battlefield of Losecote by [[Edward IV]] for being a Lancastrian *Sir Thomas Dymoke (1470) â Executed on battlefield of Losecote by [[Edward IV]] for being a Lancastrian. *[[Robert Welles, 8th Baron Willoughby de Eresby]] (1470) â Son of Richard Welles. Executed after Battle of Losecoat by [[Edward IV]] for being a Lancastrian.
*[[John Tiptoft, 1st Earl of Worcester]] â [[Lord High Treasurer]] â (1470) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VI of England|Henry VI]] for being a Yorkist<ref name= CP/> *[[Edmund Beaufort, 4th Duke of Somerset]] (1471) â Beheaded after the [[Battle of Tewkesbury]] for being a Lancastrian *[[John Courtenay, 15th Earl of Devon]] (1471) â Beheaded after the [[Battle of Tewkesbury]] for being a Lancastrian. *Sir Hugh Courtenay (1471) â Beheaded after the [[Battle of Tewkesbury]] for being a Lancastrian. *[[Sir Gervase Clifton]] (1471) - Beheaded after the [[Battle of Tewkesbury]] for being a Lancastrian *[[Bastard of Fauconberg|Sir Thomas Neville]] (1471) â Executed at Middleham Castle or Southampton by [[Edward IV]] for being a Lancastrian. <ref> {{cite web | url= http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:fkXJqJmi-L4J:en.wikisource.org/wiki/Richard_III_%28DNB00%29+Thomas+Fauconberg+execution+middleham&cd=2&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=uk&client=firefox-a&source=www.google.co.uk |title= Richard III (DNB00)|publisher = DNB|accessdate = 2011-03-30}} </ref> *[[Thomas Tresham (speaker)|Sir Thomas Tresham]] â MP for Buckinghamshire, Huntingdonshire and Northamptonshire, [[High Sheriff of Cambridgeshire and Huntingdonshire]], [[High Sheriff of Sussex]], [[High Sheriff of Surrey]], [[Comptroller of the Household]], [[Speaker of the British House of Commons|Speaker of the House of Commons]] â (1471) â Executed after the [[Battle of Tewkesbury]] for being a Lancastrian *[[Thomas Vaughan (soldier)|Sir Thomas Vaughan]] (1483) â Executed by [[Richard III of England|Richard III]] even though he was a Yorkist. *[[William Hastings, 1st Baron Hastings]] (1483) â Executed near Tower Chapel by [[Richard III of England|Richard III]] for being a Lancastrian <ref name= CP/> *[[Henry Stafford, 2nd Duke of Buckingham]] â [[Lord High Constable of England|Lord High Constable]] â (1483) â Executed by [[Richard III of England|Richard III]] for being to close the crown and also for being a Lancastrian. *[[Anthony Woodville, 2nd Earl Rivers]] â [[Chief Butler of England]] â (1483) â Executed at Pontefract castle by [[Richard III of England|Richard III]] for being a Lancastrian and uncle of the below. *[[Richard Grey|Sir Richard Grey]] (1483) â Executed at Pontefract Castle by [[Richard III of England|Richard III]] for being a Lancastrian and nephew of the above. *[[William Catesby]] (1485)- Beheaded at Leicester by [[Henry VII of England]] after the Battle of Bosworth for being a Yorkist. *[[William Stanley (Battle of Bosworth)|Sir William Stanley]] (1495) â Executed at [[Tower Hill]] by [[Henry VII of England]] for supporting the pretender Perkin Warbeck <ref name= CP/> *[[James Tuchet, 7th Baron Audley]] (1497) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VII of England]] for opposing taxation<ref name= CP/> *[[Edward Plantagenet, 17th Earl of Warwick]] â [[List of heirs to the English throne|Heir to the English Throne]] from 9 April 1484 â March 1485 â (1499) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VII of England]]<ref name= CP/> *[[James Tyrrell|Sir James Tyrrell]] (1502) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VII of England]] for treason <ref name= CP/> *Sir John Wyndham (1502)- Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VII of England]] for treason <ref name= CP/> *[[Edmund Dudley|Sir Edmund Dudley]] â [[Speaker of the British House of Commons|Speaker of the House of Commons]] â (1510) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for extortion <ref name= CP/> *[[Richard Empson|Sir Richard Empson]] â [[Speaker of the British House of Commons|Speaker of the House of Commons]], [[Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster]] â (1510) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for extortion <ref name= CP/> *[[Andrew Barton|Sir Andrew Barton]] - [[High Admiral of Scotland]] - (1511) - executed on trumped up charges of piracy. *[[Edmund de la Pole, 3rd Duke of Suffolk]] (1513) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] as Yorkist claimant to throne. <ref name= CP/> *[[Edward Stafford, 3rd Duke of Buckingham]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]] â [[Lord High Steward]] and [[Lord High Constable of England|Lord High Constable]] â (1521) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] as claimant to throne <ref name= CP/> *[[Rhys ap Thomas|Sir Rhys ap Gruffydd]] (1531) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for conspiracy with Scotland <ref name= CP/> *[[John Fisher|Saint John Fisher]] â Catholic Bishop of Rochester â (1535)- Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for refusing to take [[Oath of Supremacy]] <ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas More|Saint Sir Thomas More]] â [[Lord Chancellor]], [[Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster]], [[Speaker of the House of Commons (United Kingdom)|Speaker of the House of Commons]] â (1535) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for refusing to take [[Oath of Supremacy]]<ref name= CP/>
*[[Anne Boleyn]] â Queen of England and Henry's Wife â (1536) â Executed by sword at the [[Tower of London]] by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[George Boleyn, Viscount Rochford]] (1536) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Henry Norris (courtier)|Sir Henry Norris]] â [[groom of the stool|Groom of the Stool]] â (1536) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[William Brereton (groom)|Sir William Brereton]], [[Knight of the Bath|KB]] â [[Groom of the Chamber|Groom of the Privy Chamber]] â (1536) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Francis Weston|Sir Francis Weston]] â [[Gentleman of the Privy Chamber]] â (1536) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Mark Smeaton]] (1536) â Executed at [[Tower Hill]] by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/>
*[[Thomas Darcy, 1st Baron Darcy de Darcy]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]] (1537) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]]<ref name= CP/> *[[John Hussey, 1st Baron Hussey of Sleaford]] â [[Chief Butler of England]] â (1537) â Executed at Lincoln by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir John Constable (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir William Constable (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir Francis Bigod (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir John Bigod (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir [[Thomas Percy]]{{dn|date=September 2011}} (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir [[Henry Percy]]{{dn|date=September 2011}} (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir Stephan Hamilton (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir Nicholas Tempast (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir William Lumley (1537) â Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]] *Sir Edward Neville (1538) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for being in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]]<ref name= CP/>
*[[Henry Pole, 11th Baron Montacute]] (1539) â Executed at Tower Hill by order of [[Henry VIII of England]] for Catholicism.<ref name= CP/> *[[Henry Courtenay, 1st Marquess of Exeter]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]], [[Privy Council of England|PC]], [[Lord Warden of the Stannaries]] â (1539) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for treason <ref name= CP/> *[[Nicholas Carew (courtier)|Sir Nicholas Carew]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]], [[Privy Council of England|PC]] â [[Master of the Horse]] â (1539) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for Catholicism <ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Dingley|Sir Thomas Dingley]] (1539) â Executed at Tower Hill by order of [[Henry VIII of England]] for being implicated in the [[Pilgrimage of Grace]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Adrian Fortescue (martyr)|Blessed Sir Adrian Fortescue]] (1539) â Executed by order of [[Henry VIII of England]] for Catholicism <ref name= CP/> *[[Richard Whiting (Abbot)|Richard Whiting, Abbot of Glastonbury]] (1539) - Executed on Glastonbury Tor by Thomas Cromwell (hung, drawn and quartered). *[[Thomas Cromwell, 1st Earl of Essex]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]], [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|PC]] â [[Secretary of State (England)|Secretary of State]], [[Master of the Rolls]], [[Lord Privy Seal]], [[Governor of the Isle of Wight]], [[Justice in Eyre]], [[Lord Great Chamberlain]] (1540) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for treason <ref name= CP/> *[[Walter Hungerford, 1st Baron Hungerford of Heytesbury]] (1540) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[high treason]] and buggery.<ref> {{cite web | url= http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Hungerford,_Walter_%281503-1540%29_%28DNB00%29#Walter_Hungerford| title= Hungerford, Walter (1503-1540) (DNB00)|accessdate= 2011-03-29}} </ref> *[[Leonard Grey, 1st Viscount Grane]] â [[Lord Deputy of Ireland]] (1541) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]] after allowing the escape of his nephew [[Gerald FitzGerald, 11th Earl of Kildare]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Margaret Pole, 8th Countess of Salisbury]] (1541) â Executed at Tower Green by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[high treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Catherine Howard]] â Queen of England and Henry's Wife (1542) â Executed at Tower Green by [[Henry VIII of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Culpepper|Sir Thomas Culpepper]] (1542) â Executed at Tyburn by [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] for [[high treason]](adultery with the queen) *[[Jane Boleyn, Viscountess Rochford]] â Wife of executed [[George Boleyn, Viscount Rochford]] and sister-in-law of [[Anne Boleyn]] â (1542) â Executed at Tower Green by [[Henry VIII of England]] for High Treason <ref name= CP/> *Sir John Neville of Chevet (1546) - Executed by [[Henry VIII of England]] *[[Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]] â [[Earl Marshal]] (1547) â Executed at Tower Hill during the reign of [[Henry VIII of England]] for treason <ref name= CP/>
*[[Thomas Seymour, 1st Baron Seymour of Sudeley]] â [[Master-General of the Ordnance]], [[Lord Warden of the Cinque Ports]], [[Admiralty|Lord High Admiral]], also was the husband of [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] sixth wife and widow [[Catherine Parr]] and the brother of Henry's third wife [[Jane Seymour]] â (1549) â Beheaded for treason at Tower Hill during the reign of [[Edward VI of England]] <ref name= CP/> *[[Edward Seymour, 1st Duke of Somerset]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]], [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|PC]], [[Earl Marshal]], [[Lord High Treasurer]], [[Admiralty|Lord High Admiral]], [[Lord Protector]] of [[England]] in the period between the death of [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] in 1547 and his own indictment in 1549 â (1552) â Executed at Tower Hill during the reign of [[Edward VI of England]] for plotting murder of John Dudley<ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Arundell of Lanherne|Sir Thomas Arundell of Lanherne]] â [[Gentleman of the Privy Chamber]] â (1552) â Beheaded at Tower Hill during the reign of [[Edward VI of England]] for treason <ref name= CP/> <ref> {{cite web |url= http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Fane,_Ralph_%28DNB00%29|title= Fane, Ralph (DNB00)|accessdate= 2011-04-11}} </ref> *[[Sir Michael Stanhope]] â [[Gentleman of the Privy Chamber|Chief Gentleman of the Privy Chamber]] â (1552) â Beheaded at Tower Hill during the reign of [[Edward VI of England]]for treason <ref> {{cite web |url= http://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Fane,_Ralph_%28DNB00%29|title= Fane, Ralph (DNB00)|accessdate= 2011-04-11}} </ref> *[[John Dudley, 1st Duke of Northumberland]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â Vice-Admiral, [[Lord Admiral]], Governor of [[Boulogne]], President of the Council in the Marches, [[Lord Great Chamberlain]], [[Lord Steward|Grand Master of the Royal Household]], [[Earl Marshal of England]], [[Lord President of the Council]], Warden General of the Scottish Marches â (1553) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] for supporting Lady Jane Grey <ref name= CP/> *[[Sir John Gates]] [[Knight of the Bath|KB]] (1553) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] for supporting Lady Jane Grey <ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.hrionline.ac.uk/johnfoxe/apparatus/person_glossaryG.html|title= Foxe's Book of Martyrs| accessdate= 2011-03-29}} </ref> *[[Sir Thomas Palmer (died 1553)|Sir Thomas Palmer]] (1553) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] for supporting Lady Jane Grey <ref name= CP/> *[[Lady Jane Grey]] â [[List of English monarchs|Queen of England]] 10â19 July 1553 and [[List of heirs to the English and British thrones|Heir to the English and Irish Thrones]] 21 June â 10 July 1553 â (1554) â Executed at Tower Green by Mary I as claimant to throne <ref name= CP/> *[[Lord Guilford Dudley]] â Son of John Dudley, 1st Duke of Northumberland and [[List of English consorts|Royal Consort of England]] 10â19 July 1553 â (1554) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] for supporting Lady Jane Grey <ref name= CP/> [[File:Execution of Mary, Queen of Scots, created 1613, artist unknown.JPG|thumb|Execution of Mary, Queen of Scots]] *[[Henry Grey, 1st Duke of Suffolk]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]] - Father of the above, [[Lord Lieutenant of Leicestershire]], [[Justice in Eyre]] â (1554) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] for rebellion <ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Wyatt the younger|Sir Thomas Wyatt the Younger]] (1554) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Mary I of England|Mary I]] for rebellion <ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Howard, 4th Duke of Norfolk]], [[Order of the Garter|KG]] â [[Earl Marshal]] â (1573) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Elizabeth I of England]] for [[Ridolfi plot]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Percy, 7th Earl of Northumberland]] (1572) â Executed at York by [[Elizabeth I of England]] for taking part in the [[Rising of the North]] *[[Thomas Doughty (explorer)|Sir Thomas Doughty]] (1578) â Executed by [[Francis Drake|Sir Francis Drake]] *[[Edward Arden]] (1583) â Executed at [[Tyburn]] by [[Elizabeth I of England]] for [[high treason]] (hanged, drawn and quartered) *[[Francis Throckmorton|Sir Francis Throckmorton]] (1584) â Executed by [[Elizabeth I of England]] *[[Anthony Babington]] (1586} â Executed at [[Tower Hill]] for treason via the [[Babington Plot]] (hung, drawn and quartered) [[File:Execution of Sir Walter Raleigh.jpg|thumb|Raleigh just before being beheaded â an illustration from c. 1860]] *[[Mary, Queen of Scots]] â [[List of Scottish monarchs|Queen of Scots]] and [[List of French consorts|Queen consort of France]] â (1587) â Executed by [[Elizabeth I of England]]. *[[Robert Devereux, 2nd Earl of Essex]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Master of the Horse]], [[Earl Marshal]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Ireland]], [[Custos Rotulorum of Pembrokeshire]], [[Custos Rotulorum of Staffordshire]], [[Master-General of the Ordnance]] â (1601) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Elizabeth I of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Christopher Blount|Sir Christopher Blount]] (1601) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Elizabeth I of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Charles Danvers|Sir Charles Danvers]] (1601) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Elizabeth I of England]] for [[High Treason]]<ref> {{cite web | url= http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/7132| title=Danvers, Sir Charles (c.1568â1601), soldier and conspirator| publisher= Oxford DNB| accessdate= 2011-03-29}} </ref> [[Image:Contemporary German print depicting Charles Is beheading.jpg|thumb|This contemporary German print depicts Charles I's decapitation in 1649.]]
*[[Walter Raleigh|Sir Walter Raleigh]] â [[Lord Warden of the Stannaries]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Cornwall]], [[Vice-Admiral of Devon]], [[Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard]], [[Governor of Jersey]] â (1618) â Executed in the [[Old Palace Yard]], Westminster by orders of James VI and I *[[Mervyn Touchet, 2nd Earl of Castlehaven]] - Executed at Tower Hill for aiding buggery (1631)<ref name= CP/> *[[Thomas Wentworth, 1st Earl of Strafford]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Custos Rotulorum of the West Riding of Yorkshire]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Yorkshire]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Ireland|Lord Deputy of Ireland]], [[List of Lord Lieutenants of Ireland|Lord Lieutenant of Ireland]] â (1641) â Executed at Tower Hill on orders of [[Parliament]]<ref name= CP/> *Archbishop [[William Laud]] â [[Archbishop of Canterbury]] â (1645) â Executed at Tower Hill on orders of [[Parliament]] <ref name= CP/> *[[John Hotham the younger|Sir John Hotham the Younger]] (2 January 1645) â Executed at Tower Hill on orders of [[Parliament]] for betraying the parliamentarians to the Royalists <ref name= CP/> *[[Sir John Hotham, 1st Baronet| Sir John Hotham, 1st Baronet the Elder]], of Scorborough (died 3 January 1645) â Father of above â Executed for betraying the parliamentarians to the Royalists <ref name= CP/> *[[Charles I of England]] and Scotland (1649) â Executed in Whitehall, London by Cromwell's Parliament [[File:Monmouth's Execution.gif|250px|thumb|Execution of [[James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth]] by [[Jack Ketch]] on Tower Hill, 15 July 1685 (O.S), in a popular print.]]
*[[James Hamilton, 1st Duke of Hamilton]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Master of the Horse]], [[Lord Chancellor of Scotland]] â (1649) â Executed by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist *[[Arthur Capell, 1st Baron Capell of Hadham]] (1649) â Executed by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist *[[Henry Rich, 1st Earl of Holland]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Master of the Horse]], [[Captain of the Yeomen of the Guard]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Berkshire]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Middlesex]], [[Justice in Eyre]] â (1649) â Executed in London by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist *[[Henry Hyde (Royalist)|Sir Henry Hyde]] (1650) - Beheaded in London by Cromwell's Parliament for being s Royalist. *[[James Stanley, 7th Earl of Derby]], [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] â [[Lord Lieutenant of Cheshire]], [[Lord Lieutenant of Lancashire|Lancashire]], [[Vice-Admiral of Cheshire]] â (1651) â Executed at Bolton by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist *[[John Penruddock|Sir John Penruddock]] (1619â1655) â Executed at Exeter by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist *[[Sir Henry Slingsby, 1st Baronet]] (1658) â Beheaded on Tower Hill, London by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist <ref name= CP/> *[[John Hewett (chaplain)|Reverend Dr. John Huett]] (1658) â Beheaded on Tower Hill, London by Cromwell's Parliament for being a Royalist <ref name= CP/> *[[Oliver Cromwell]] (1661) â although already dead, he was beheaded by order of [[Charles II of England|Charles II]]; some believe his mother ordered it *[[Henry Vane the Younger|Sir Henry Vane the Younger]] (1662) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[Charles II of England|Charles II]] for the death of his father Charles I <ref name= CP/> *[[John Twyn]] (1663) - Hanged, drawn, quartered and beheaded (and head displayed on a Ludgate spike) for publishing an anonymous pamphlet justifying the right of rebellion against the king *[[William Howard, 1st Viscount Stafford]] (1680) â Executed at Tower Hill by being falsely accused of treason <ref name= CP/> *[[William Russell, Lord Russell]] â [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Tavistock (UK Parliament constituency)|Tavistock]] and [[Tavistock (UK Parliament constituency)|Tavistock]] â (1683) â Executed for being involved with the [[Rye House Plot]] *[[Algernon Sidney]] (1683) â Executed at Tower Hill for being involved with the [[Rye House Plot]]<ref name= CP/> *[[Sir Thomas Armstrong]] â [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Stafford (UK Parliament constituency)|Stafford]] (1684) â Executed by [[George Jeffreys, 1st Baron Jeffreys|Judge Jeffreys]] for supporting Monmouth *[[James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth]] (1685) â Executed at Tower Hill by [[James II of England|James II]] after the [[Battle of Sedgemoor]] for treason. <ref name= CP/> *Lady [[Alice Lisle]] (1685) â Executed at Winchester by Judge Jeffreys during the [[Bloody Assizes]] for harbouring Monmouth rebels *[[Sir John Fenwick, 3rd Baronet|Sir John Fenwick]] (1697) â Jacobite Rebel executed at Tower Hill in reign of [[William III of England|William III]] for treason <ref name= CP/>
==European New World colonies== [[Image:Blackbeard head bow.gif|thumb|Blackbeard's severed head hanging from [[Robert Maynard|Maynard]]'s bowsprit]] [[Image:Diego-de-Almagro.png|thumb|right|Execution of Diego de Almagro]]
*'''[[Colonial history of the United States|British North America]]''' :[[Metacomet]] (1676) - New England Indian chief "King Philip" executed for resisting white settlement. :[[Blackbeard]] (1718) - Famous pirate beheaded after capture at [[Ocracoke Island]] *'''[[Panama]]''' :[[Vasco NÃºÃ±ez de Balboa]] (1519) - Spanish conquistador who discovered the Pacific Ocean. Executed by rivals [[Francisco Pizarro]] and [[Pedro Arias de Avila]] *'''[[Haiti]]''' :[[Dutty Boukman]] (1791) - Executed by the French for promoting a slave rebellion. *'''[[Brazil]]''' : Joaquim JosÃ© da Silva Xavier ([[Tiradentes]]) (1792) â the body was quartered after his hanging for revolutionary activity *'''[[Mexico]]''' :[[Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla]] and [[Ignacio Allende]] (1811) - Mexican insurgents were beheaded after their [[execution by firing squad]] *'''[[Bolivia]]''' :[[Manuel Ascencio Padilla]] (1816) - Executed for insurrection after the Battle of La Laguna. *'''[[Peru]]''' :[[Diego de Almagro]] (1538) â Executed in Cuzco by his rival [[Francisco Pizarro]] :[[Gonzalo Pizarro]] (1548) â Executed in Peru by [[Pedro de la Gasca]] for rebellion.
==Finland== *[[Tahvo Putkonen]] (1825) - beheaded for murder. This was the last beheading in Finland.{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}}
==France== ===''[[Ancien Regime]]''=== *Olivier III de Clisson (1343) â executed by [[Philip VI of France]] for treason. *[[Jean de Montaigu]] (1409) â executed in Paris by [[Charles VI of France]] *[[Comte de Montgomery|Gabriel de Lorges, Comte de Montgomery]] (1574) â executed by [[Catherine de Medici]] for treason *[[Henri de Talleyrand-PÃ©rigord, comte de Chalais]] (1626) â executed in Nantes for conspiracy against [[Cardinal Richelieu]] *[[Jean-FranÃ§ois de la Barre]] (1766) â beheaded and burnt in AbbÃ©ville for blasphemy.

*[[Camille Desmoulins]] (1794) â Guillotined for plotting against [[Robespierre]] *[[Marie Jean HÃ©rault de SÃ©chelles]] (1794) â Guillotined for plotting against [[Robespierre]] *[[FranÃ§ois Joseph Westermann]] (1794) â Guillotined for plotting against [[Robespierre]] *[[Pierre Philippeaux]] (1794) â Guillotined for plotting against [[Robespierre]] *[[Maximilien Robespierre]] (1794) â Guillotined by order of the [[Committee of General Security]] *[[Georges Couthon]] (1794) â Guillotined by order of the [[Committee of General Security]] *[[Louis Antoine de Saint-Just]] (1794) â Guillotined by order of the [[Committee of General Security]] *[[Alexandre de Beauharnais]] (1794) â Husband of Josephine (who remarried Napoleon). Guillotined *[[FranÃ§oise-ThÃ©rÃ¨se de Choiseul-Stainville, Princesse Joseph de Monaco]] (1794) â Guillotined *[[AndrÃ© ChÃ©nier]] (1794) â Poet, guillotined on trumped-up charges *[[Antoine Quentin Fouquier-Tinville]] (1795) â Guillotined for abuse of his post as Public Prosecutor.
===[[Bourbon Restoration|Restoration]]=== *[[Four Sergeants of La Rochelle]] (1822) â executed for treason against [[Louis XVIII of France]] *[[Giuseppe Marco Fieschi]] (1836) - executed by guillotine for attempting to assassinate King [[Louis-Philippe]]
===[[Republic of France]]=== * FranÃ§ois Claudius Koenigstein, known as [[Ravachol]] (1892) â Guillotined for murder and anarchy *[[Sante Geronimo Caserio]] (1894) â executed for assassination of president [[Marie FranÃ§ois Sadi Carnot]]. *[[TÃ©ophile Deroo, the "Pollet Band"]] (1909) - guillotined in BÃ©thune (Nord-Pas-de-Calais), by Anatole Deibler, for a series of murders *[[Canut Vromant, the "Pollet Band"]] (1909) - guillotined in BÃ©thune (Nord-Pas-de-Calais), by Anatole Deibler, for a series of murders *[[Auguste Pollet, the "Pollet Band"]] (1909) - guillotined in BÃ©thune (Nord-Pas-de-Calais), by Anatole Deibler, for a series of murders *[[Abel Pollet, the "Pollet Band"]] (1909) - guillotined in BÃ©thune (Nord-Pas-de-Calais), by Anatole Deibler, for a series of murders *[[Henri Landru]] (1922) â executed for serial murder. *[[Paul Gorguloff]] (1932)- executed in Paris for assassination of President [[Paul Doumer]] *[[Eugen Weidmann]] (1939) â Executed for murder. Last public execution by guillotine in France. *[[Jacques Fesch]] (1957) â executed in Paris for killing a policeman. *[[Christian Ranucci]] (1976) - guillotined in Marseille for murder *[[JÃ©rÃ´me Carrein]] (1977) - guillotined in Douai for murder *[[Hamida Djandoubi]] (1977) â guillotined in Marseille for murder â last guillotine execution
==Georgia== *[[Demetre II of Georgia|Demetre II]] (1289) â Executed by the Mongol [[Arghun Khan]] for rebellion.
==Germany== ===Pre-20th century=== [[Image:Hinrichtung.jpg|thumb|300px|Execution of Pirates in Hamburg, 1573]] *[[Thomas MÃ¼ntzer]] (1525) â beheaded after the [[Battle of Frankenhausen]] during [[German Peasants' War]] *[[Ludwig Haetzer]] (1529) â Executed in Konstanz for protestant radicalism (but technically for adultery) *[[Max HÃ¶del]] (1878) â Executed for attempting to assassinate Emperor [[Wilhelm I]]
===[[Weimar Republic]]=== *[[Peter KÃ¼rten]] (1931) â The Vampire of DÃ¼sseldorf â Guillotined in Cologne for murder.
===[[Nazi Germany]]=== [[Image:PlÃ¶tzenseedeathroom.jpg|thumb|right|The execution room at PlÃ¶tzensee Prison, Berlin and guillotine.]] *[[Bruno Tesch (antifascist)|Bruno Tesch]] (1933) â Executed in Altona with three others after "Bloody Sunday". *[[Marinus van der Lubbe]] (1934) â Guillotined in Leipzig for starting the Reichstag fire. *[[Benita von Falkenhayn]] and [[Renate von Natzmer]] (1935) â Executed by axe in Berlin for espionage. *[[Helmut Hirsch]] (1937) â Executed in Berlin for treason. *[[Lilo Herrmann]] (1938) â Guillotined in Berlin for treason. *[[Maurice Bavaud]] (1941) â Guillotined in Berlin for attempting to assassinate Hitler. *[[Helmuth HÃ¼bener]] (1942) â Guillotined in Berlin for treason. *[[Ilse StÃ¶be]] (1942) â Guillotined in Berlin for treason via [[Red Orchestra (espionage)|Red Orchestra]]. *[[Rudolf von Scheliha]] (1942) â Guillotined in Berlin for treason via [[Red Orchestra (espionage)|Red Orchestra]]. *[[Franz JÃ¤gerstÃ¤tter]] (1943) â Guillotined in Berlin as a concientious objector. *[[Maria Restituta]] (1943) â Guillotined for treason. *[[Cato Bontjes van Beek]] (1943) â Guillotined in Berlin for conspiracy to commit treason *[[Julius FuÄÃ­k (journalist)|Julius FuÄÃ­k]] (1943) - Guillotined in Berlin for anti-Nazi resistance. *[[Mildred Harnack]] (1943) â American born. Guillotined in Berlin for anti-Nazi activity via [[Red Orchestra (espionage)|Red Orchestra]]. *[[Sophie Scholl]] (1943) â Guillotined for treason via [[White Rose]] resistance group. *[[Hans Scholl]] (1943) â brother of above â Guillotined for treason via [[White Rose]] resistance group. *[[Christoph Probst]] (1943) â Guillotined for treason via [[White Rose]] resistance group. *[[Willi Graf]] (1943) â Guillotined for treason via [[White Rose]] resistance group. *[[Alex Schmorell]] (1943) â Guillotined for treason via [[White Rose]] resistance group. *[[Kurt Huber]] (1943) â Guillotined for treason via [[White Rose]] resistance group. *[[Otto and Elise Hampel]] (1943) â Guillotined in Berlin for treason. *[[Musa CÃ¤lil]] (1944) â Guillotined in Berlin for anti-Nazi activities * [[Werner Seelenbinder]] (1944) - beheaded with an axe , for being a communist.
==Great Britain== :''See also the sections on [[List of people who were beheaded#England|England]], [[List of people who were beheaded#Scotland|Scotland]] and [[List of people who were beheaded#Wales|Wales]] for beheadings before the [[Union of 1707]].'' *[[William Gordon, 6th Viscount of Kenmure]] (1716) â executed at Tower Hill as a Jacobite Rebel <ref name = CP/> *[[James Radclyffe, 3rd Earl of Derwentwater]] (1716) â executed at Tower Hill as a Jacobite Rebel <ref name = CP/> *[[Arthur Elphinstone, 6th Lord Balmerinoch]] (1746) â beheaded at Tower Hill as a Jacobite supporter of [[Charles Edward Stuart|Prince Charles Edward Stuart]], he was taken prisoner at [[Battle of Culloden|Culloden]] <ref name = CP/> *[[William Boyd, 4th Earl of Kilmarnock]] (1746) â beheaded at Tower Hill as a Jacobite supporter of [[Charles Edward Stuart|Prince Charles Edward Stuart]], he was taken prisoner at [[Battle of Culloden|Culloden]] <ref name = CP/> *[[Charles Radclyffe]], titular 5th Earl of Derwentwater (1746) â executed at Tower Hill as a Jacobite Rebel <ref name = CP/> *[[Simon Fraser, 11th Lord Lovat]] (1747) â executed at Tower Hill as a prominent veteran Jacobite supporter of Prince [[Charles Edward Stuart]]. Though too old to participate in the 1745 Rising, he was chosen by the British Crown for execution in lieu of his youthful son, who had actually led Clan Fraser for the Jacobite cause <ref name = CP/> *[[Henry Byng, 4th Earl of Strafford|Hon. Henry William John, later 4th Earl of Strafford]] (1899)- decapitated by a train.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C02E2D71030E333A25754C1A9639C94689ED7CF |title=EARL OF STRAFFORD KILLED; Decapitated by an Express Train at a Railroad|newspaper=New York Times | date=17 May 1899 | accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref>
*Gerald Mellin (2008) â see [[List of unusual deaths]] *David Phyall (2008) â see [[List of unusual deaths]] *Jolanta Bledaite (2008)â Lithuanian immigrant, tortured and killed in Scotland<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/tayside_and_central/7927892.stm Life for head-on-beach murderers] BBC NEWS, 6 March 2009</ref>
==Hungary== *[[LÃ¡szlÃ³ Hunyadi]] (1457) â Executed by [[Ladislaus V]] for plotting against him.
==India== *[[Guru Tegh Bahadur]] (1675) - Sikh executed in Delhi by order of Mogul emperor [[Aurangzeb]] for non-conversion to Islam.

==Italy== [[Image:EugÃ¨ne Ferdinand Victor Delacroix 019.jpg|250px|thumb|''The Execution of Marino Faliero'', [[EugÃ¨ne Delacroix]], 1827.]]
===Ancient Rome=== *[[Lucius Appuleius Saturninus]] (100 BC) - radical [[Tribune of the People|tribune]]; [[Gaius Rabirius]] toyed with his severed head at a dinner party *[[Marcus Antonius Orator]] (87 BC) â grandfather of Marc Antony *[[Marcus Marius Gratidianus]] (82 BC), [[praetor]] whose head was paraded through Rome after execution *[[Marcus Licinius Crassus]] (53 BC) â general, politician and richest man then in the world - beheaded posthumously after his defeat in [[Parthia]] *[[Publius Licinius Crassus (son of triumvir)|Publius Licinius Crassus]] (53 BC) â son of Marcus Licinius Crassus - beheaded posthumously in Parthia *[[Pompey]] the Great (48 BC) â general, politician and member of the [[First Triumvirate]] - assassinated and beheaded posthumously in Egypt *[[Gnaeus Pompeius]] (45 BC) â Pompey's son - executed for treason by [[Julius Caesar]] *[[Titus Labienus]] (45 BC) â general, politician and one of [[Julius Caesar]]'s foremost subordinates - Killed and beheaded posthumously at the [[Battle of Munda]] *[[Gaius Trebonius]] (43 BC) - politician and general, tortured and beheaded by [[Publius Cornelius Dolabella]]; his head was kicked around like a football by Dolabella's soldiers *[[Cicero]] (43 BC) â politician, lawyer and Rome's greatest orator - executed by order of Marc Anthony *[[Marcus Antonius Antyllus]] (30 BC) â son of Marc Antony - executed by Octavian *[[Galba]] (69) - assassinated Roman emperor *[[Pope Stephen I]] (257) â Christian Martyr executed by Emperor [[Valerian (emperor)|Valerian]] *[[Pope Sixtus II]] (258) â Christian Martyr executed by Emperor [[Valerian (emperor)|Valerian]] *[[Stilicho]] (408) â executed in coup d'Ã©tat after Gothic invasion. *[[Anthemius]] (472) â Emperor â Assassinated by [[Ricimer]]
===Medieval Italy===
*[[Conradin]], King of Sicily (29 October 1268) - Executed in Naples by Charles of Anjou *[[Frederick I of Baden]], Margrave of Baden (29 October 1268) - Executed in Naples by Charles of Anjou *[[Marino Faliero]], Doge of Venice (1355) â Executed for a failed coup d'Ã©tat.
===Later Italy=== {{Expand section|date=February 2010}} *[[Giovanni Carafa, Duke of Paliano]] (1561) - executed by order of Pope [[Pius IV]]<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=SrUNi2m_qZAC&pg=PA752&lpg=PA752&dq=giovanni+carafa+Duke+paliana&source=bl&ots=J4oFjGh9Yb&sig=UVZC1HleppJAKoGy2K8jN_68i1A&hl=en&ei=dKJpTN-9GYuOjAfG4fDUBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBUQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=giovanni%20carafa%20Duke%20paliana&f=false|title= The Pacy and the Levant|publisher=Google Books|accessdate = 16 August 2010}}</ref> *[[Beatrice Cenci]] and [[Lucrezia Peroni]] (1599) â executed in Rome for murder of Francesco Cenci *[[Felice Orsini]] (1858) â Executed by [[NapolÃ©on III]] for attempting to assassinate him.
==Japan== ===Home islands=== [[Image:LeonardGSiffleet.jpg|right|thumb|upright|Sergeant Siffleet's execution at Aitape, 1943]] *[[Ishida Mitsunari]], [[daimyo]] and general (1600) - beheaded in Kyoto after the Battle of [[Sekigahara]] *[[Ankokuji Ekei]], Buddhist monk and ally of Mitsunari (1600) - beheaded in Kyoto after the Battle of [[Sekigahara]] *[[Konishi Yukinaga]] (1600)- ally of Mitsunari - beheaded in Kyoto after the Battle of [[Sekigahara]] *[[Asano Naganori]], lord of the [[Forty-seven Ronin]] (1701) - ordered to commit [[seppuku]] (hari kiri) followed by beheading *[[KondÅ Isami]], commander of the [[Shinsengumi]] (1868) - executed at [[Itabashi]]
===Japanese occupied territories (20th century)=== *Chinese prisoners during the [[Nanjing massacre]] (1937) *Filipino and American prisoners during the [[Bataan Death March]] (1942) *[[Leonard Siffleet]] (1943) - Australian soldier executed in [[Papua New Guinea]] by Japanese captors *[[Stanley James Woodbridge]], British RAF crewman (1945) - captured and beheaded by Japanese forces in [[Burma]]
==Korea== * Columba Kim (1839) - beheaded for being Christian. * [[Laurent-Marie-Joseph Imbert]] (1839) - beheaded in Saenamteo for being Christian

Stewart, Earl of Atholl|Walter Stewart, 1st Earl of Atholl]] (1437) â Executed for his part in the murder of [[James I of Scotland]] *[[William Douglas, 6th Earl of Douglas]] (1440) â Executed on of Finnart]] â [[Master of Work to the Crown of Scotland]] â (1540) â Executed by order of [[James V of Scotland]] *[[James Douglas, 4th Earl of Morton]] (1581) â Executed on the [[Maiden (beheading)|Scottish maiden]] for complicty in murder of [[Lord Darnley]] *[[William Ruthven, 1st Earl of Gowrie]] (1584) â Executed by order of [[James VI of Scotland]] *[[Patrick Stewart, 2nd Earl of Orkney]] (1615) â Executed by order of [[James VI of Scotland]] *[[Sir John Gordon, 1st Baronet, of Haddo]] (1644) â Executed on the [[Maiden (beheading)|Scottish maiden]] by the [[Covenanters]] for treason as a Royalist. *[[Archibald Campbell, 1st Marquess of Argyll]] (1661) â Executed by order of [[Charles II of Scotland]] on the [[Maiden (beheading)|Scottish maiden]] for treason. *[[Archibald Campbell, 9th Earl of Argyll]] (1685) â son of above. Executed by order of [[James VII of Scotland]] on the [[Maiden (beheading)|Scottish maiden]] for treason. *[[Godfrey McCulloch]] (1697) â Executed on the [[Maiden (beheading)|Scottish maiden]] for murder. Last man to be executed by the maiden.
==Spain== * [[Eulogius of Cordova]] (859) â Executed by Muslim rulers for blasphemy. * [[Rodrigo Calderon]] (1621) - Executed in Madrid. * [[Antonio Osorio de AcuÃ±a]] (1526) â Executed in Simancas for supporting the [[Comunero Revolt]]. * [[Juan Bravo]] (1521) - Executed in Villalar de los Comuneros, Valladolid. * [[Juan de Padilla]] (1521) - Executed in Villalar de los Comuneros, Valladolid. * [[Francisco Maldonado]] (1521) - Executed in Villalar de los Comuneros, Valladolid.
==Sweden== [[Image:YngsjÃ¶-murderer.jpg|right|250px|thumb|Execution of Anna MÃ¥nsdotter. The [[executioner]] [[Albert Gustaf Dahlman|Dalman]] stands to the far left, hiding his axe behind his back.]] * Matthias Gregersson (1520) - Bishop of StrÃ¤ngnÃ¤s. Executed by Danes in the [[Stockholm Bloodbath]] * Vincens Henningsson (1520) - Bishop of Skara. Executed by Danes in the [[Stockholm Bloodbath]] * [[Anna Zippel]] (1676) â Executed in Stockholm for witchcraft. * [[Brita Zippel]] (1676) â sister of above. Executed in Stockholm for witchcraft. * [[Jacob Johan AnckarstrÃ¶m]] (1792) â executed for assassination of Gustav III * [[Anna MÃ¥nsdotter]] (1890) - executed by axe for murder. Last woman executed in Sweden. * [[John Filip Nordlund]] (1900) - Executed by axe in VÃ¤sterÃ¥s for mass murder. * [[Johan Alfred Ander]] (1910) - Executed by guillotine in Stockholm for murder. Last Swedish execution.
==Switzerland== [[Image:Greifensee Tschachtlan.jpg|thumb|right|Execution of Greifensee garrison]] *[[w:de:Wildhans von Breitenlandenberg|Wildhans von Breitenlandenberg]] and 61 companions following the siege of [[Greifensee, Zurich|Greifensee]] during the [[Old ZÃ¼rich War]] (1444) *[[Anna GÃ¶ldi]] (1782) â Executed as the "last witch in Switzerland"
==United States== :''For beheadings before 1776, see the [[List of people who were beheaded#European New World colonies|European New World colonies section above]]'' *At least 21 insurgent black slaves executed (1811) after the [[1811 German Coast Uprising|German Coast Uprising]] near [[New Orleans]], [[Louisiana]]. Their heads were displayed on pikes and gates as a warning. *[[Isaac N. Ebey]] (1857) - [[Washington state]] pioneer murdered by [[Haida people|Haida]] Indians. *[[Pearl Bryan]] (1896) â Murdered in Fort Thomas, Kentucky *[[Tom Ketchum]] (1901) â accidentally decapitated in New Mexico Territory in botched hanging for train robbery. *Some victims of [[Danny Rolling]] *Victims of [[Jeffrey Dahmer]] (1978â1991) *[[Helmuth Koinigg]] (1974) â decapitated in racing car crash. *[[Boris Sagal]] (1981) â decapitated by helicopter. *[[Murder of Adam Walsh|Adam Walsh]] (1981) â decapitated by murderer. *[[Vic Morrow]] (1982) â decapitated by crashing helicopter. *[[Russell Phillips]] (1995) â decapitated in racing car crash *[[Robert Lees]] (2004) â decapitated by murderer *[[Aasiya Zubair]] (2009) â decapitated in New York state by murderer/husband [[Muzzammil Hassan]]. *[[Murder of Yang Xin|Yang Xin]] (2009) â decapitated by murderer.
==Vietnam== [[Image:Matyrdom of Saint Pierre Borie 1838 Vietnam.jpg|right|thumb|Execution of Pierre Dumoulin-Borie]] * [[Vicente Liem de la Paz]] (1773) - Beheaded in Tonkin as Christian martyr * [[Pierre Dumoulin-Borie]] (1838) - Beheaded in Tonkin as Christian martyr * [[Bernard Due Van Vo]] (1838) - Beheaded in Korea as Christian martyr * [[Andrew Dung-Lac]] (1839) - Beheaded in Korea as Christian martyr * [[Augustin Schoeffler]] (1851) - Beheaded in Tonkin as Christian martyr * [[Jean-Louis Bonnard]] (1852) - Beheaded in Korea as Christian martyr * [[Michael Dinh-Hy Ho]] (1857) - Beheaded in Korea as Christian martyr * [[ThÃ©ophane VÃ©nard]] (1861) - Beheaded in Tonkin as Christian martyr * [[Ba Cut]] (LÃª Quang Vinh) (1956) - Guillotined in Cáº§n ThÆ¡ for insurrection and multiple murder
==Wales== :''For Welsh beheadings after 1707, see the [[List of people who were beheaded#Great Britain|Great Britain section above]]''
*[[Gwenllian ferch Gruffudd]] (February 1136) - executed by the Anglo-Norman forces led by Maurice de Londres at Kidwelly Castle, Wales, after a failed uprising.
==Religious figures== ===Biblical accounts=== [[Image:Judith Beheading Holofernes by Caravaggio.jpg|thumb|right|Judith beheading Holofernes]] *[[Goliath]] â according to Scripture (in the [[Old Testament]]), after he was killed by [[David]], this example illustrates the aforementioned post-mortem decapitation *[[John the Baptist]] in the [[Gospel]]s by order of [[Herod Antipas]] *[[Holofernes]] in the [[deuterocanonical books|deuterocanonical]] ''[[Book of Judith]]'' (historical accuracy disputed) *[[James, son of Zebedee|Apostle James]], traditionally<ref>[http://www.brow.on.ca/Books/Acts/Acts12.htm Acts of the Apostles: Commentary]</ref> *[[Saint Paul|Apostle Paul]], traditionally<ref>[http://www.biblepath.com/paul.html Apostle Saul (Paul)]</ref>
===Christian saints=== [[Image:DublinTrinityCollegeMSEi40LifeAlbanFol38rMartyrdomAlban.jpg|thumb|right|The martyrdom of St Alban, from a 13th century manuscript, now in the Trinity College Library, Dublin]] [[Image:CosmasDamianfraangelico.jpg|thumb|right|The martyrdom of Saints Cosmas and Damian by Fra Angelico (Musee du Louvre, Paris)]] [[Image:Nicasius maryrdom Louvre OA6119.jpg|thumb|right|The martyrdom of St Nicasius]]
*[[Acisclus|Saint Acisclus]] *[[Agnes of Rome|Saint Agnes]] *[[Saint Alban]] (around 304)- Executed in Britain by Romans for converting to Christianity. *[[Ansanus|Saint Ansanus]] *[[Anthimus of Rome|Saint Anthimus of Rome]] *[[Saint Catherine of Alexandria]] *[[Saint Christopher]] *[[Columba of Spain|Saint Columba]] of [[Spain]] (c853) - Executed in Spain by Moors for not converting to Islam. *[[Columba of Sens|Saint Columba]] of [[France]] *[[Columba the Virgin|Saint Columba (the Virgin)]] of [[Cornwall]], [[England]] *[[Saints Cosmas and Damian]] (c.287) - Executed by Emperor Diocletian in purge of Christians in Syria. *[[Saint Cyprian]] (258) â Bishop of Carthage, North Africa â Christian Martyr executed by Emperor [[Valerian (emperor)|Valerian]] *[[Denis|Saint Denis]], who carried his head to his final resting place, a familiar hagiographical [[Trope (literature)|trope]] (see [[Cephalophore]]) *[[Saint Diomedes]] *[[Saint Dymphna]] *[[Eurosia|Saint Eurosia]] *[[Felicitas of Rome|Saint Felicitas of Rome]] *[[Nabor and Felix|Saints Felix and Nabor]] *[[Firmus and Rusticus|Saints Firmus and Rusticus]] *[[Saint George]] *[[Gereon|Saint Gereon]] *[[Gordianus and Epimachus|Saint Gordianus]] *[[John Fisher|Saint John Fisher]] (1535) - beheaded in London for treason *[[John de Brito|Saint John de Brito]] (1693) - executed in India for preaching Christianity. *[[Marcellus of Tangier|Saint Marcellus]] *[[Maximilian (martyr)|Saint Maximilian]] (295) - Exucuted by Romans for concientious objection to military service. *[[Nicasius of Rheims|Saint Nicasius of Rheims]], at [[Reims|Rheims]] (407) - Executed by Vandals during conquest of Rheims. *[[Oliver Plunkett|Saint Oliver Plunkett]] (1681) - Hung, drawn and quartered in London for treason. *[[Pancras of Rome|Saint Pancras]] *[[Polyeuctus|Saint Polyeuctus]] *[[Quiteria|Saint Quiteria]] *[[Rufina and Secunda|Saints Rufina and Secunda]] *[[Simplicius, Faustinus and Beatrix|Saints Simplicius and Faustinus]] *[[Typasius|Saint Typasius]] *[[Urith|Saint Urith]] of [[Chittlehampton]], [[Devon]], [[England]] *[[Venantius of Camerino|Saint Venantius]], at [[Camerino]] *[[Winefride|Saint Winefride]] of [[Flintshire]] in [[Wales]] *[[Saint Andrew Kim|Saint Andrew Kim Taegon]] of [[Korea]] (1846) - Beheaded in Korea for being Christian. *[[Thomas More|Saint Thomas More]] (1535) - Beheaded in London for treason.
===Islamic=== * [[Imam]] [[Husayn ibn Ali]] and his 72 companions (680) â at the [[Battle of Karbala]] * 2700 Muslim prisoners of [[Richard I of England]] (1191) â after the [[Siege of Acre (1189â1191)|Battle of Acre]]
===Sikh=== * [[Guru Tegh Bahadur]] (1675) â for refusing to convert to Islam. * [[Baba Deep Singh]] (1757) â in the Battle of Amritsa * [[Sikh holocaust of 1746 (Chhotaa Ghallooghaaraa)|1000 Sikhs (1746)]] â executed by Lakhpat Rai in Lahore.
